Class BaseMenuController

java.lang.Object
clientGUI.Controllers.MenuControlls.BaseMenuController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatIF
Direct Known Subclasses:
ManageReservationController, ManageTablesController, NewReservationController, OccasionalLoginController, OccasionalMenuController, OccasionalRegistrationController, PayBillEntryController, PaymentUIController, RemoteLoginController, RepresentativeDashboardController, SubscriberLoginController, SubscriberMenuController, TerminalMenuController, ViewReservationController
public abstract class BaseMenuController extends Object implements ChatIF
Abstract base controller that defines the shared session state for the Bistro UI. It serves as the foundation for the "Pipe" architecture, ensuring that the network client and user identity are propagated across all menu screens.

  • Method Details

    • getClient

      public ChatClient getClient()
      Retrieves the active network client instance.
      Returns:
      The ChatClient used for server communication.

    • getUserType

      public String getUserType()
      Retrieves the current user's role type.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user's role.

    • getUserId

      public int getUserId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the user.
      Returns:
      The database user ID as an integer.

    • setSessionData

      public void setSessionData(String userType, int userId)
      Updates the session-specific data for the current screen.
      Parameters:
      userType - The role type to assign to this session.
      userId - The unique user ID to assign.

    • setActingAsSubscriber

      public void setActingAsSubscriber(boolean actingAsSubscriber)
      Configures whether the current controller is operating in "Acting as Subscriber" mode.
      Parameters:
      actingAsSubscriber - True if staff is in customer mode, false otherwise.

    • setOriginalUserType

      public void setOriginalUserType(String originalUserType)
      Preserves the original user role before a role-switch occurs.
      Parameters:
      originalUserType - The role string (e.g., "Manager") to be saved.

    • setClient

      public void setClient(ChatClient client, String userType, int userId)
      Injects the network client, applies session data, and triggers the lifecycle hook. This is the primary entry point for the "Pipe" data injection.
      Parameters:
      client - The active ChatClient instance.
      userType - The role of the user.
      userId - The unique ID of the user.

    • onClientReady

      public void onClientReady()
      Lifecycle hook method that is automatically called after the client and session data are injected. Subclasses should override this to perform screen-specific initialization.

    • display

      public void display(Object message)
      Implementation of the ChatIF interface for receiving asynchronous server messages.
      Specified by:
      display in interface ChatIF
      Parameters:
      message - The data object received from the server.
